decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through ritual spells and Lotus Petal, then utilizing card draw and selection to find and play a storm finisher like Tendrils of Agony or Past in Flames. It also includes disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to chain together a series of spells in a single turn to generate a lethal storm count and win the game in one explosive turn. The deck requires careful timing and sequencing of spells to maximize its potential.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells, while also gaining card advantage through its manipulation of the top of the deck with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Predict. The win conditions of the deck are typically through resolving powerful spells like Terminus or Entreat the Angels, or generating a board presence with Monastery Mentor. By utilizing a combination of control elements and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in the late game.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans by controlling the battlefield with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker. The deck also includes cards like Mother of Runes and Stoneforge Mystic to protect its own creatures and provide additional advantages through equipment like Swords to Plowshares and Aether Vial. The goal is to apply pressure with efficient threats while hindering the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a victory through a combination of aggro and control elements.

The key idea behind this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats quickly and efficiently. By utilizing a combination of countermagic, hand disruption, and aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and control the tempo of the game. Utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, alongside powerful utility lands like Wasteland, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from stabilizing. The deck's mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy while also providing access to multiple colors for maximum flexibility.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf while using countermagic and disruption spells like Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember to deal with threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to pressure the opponent early and maintain tempo advantage throughout the game. The primary goal is to establish a fast clock and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also utilizes cheap and disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Cabal Therapy to control the pace of the game and protect its threats. By combining creatures with spells that can provide card advantage and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and close out games before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating value through a mixture of disruption and efficient threats. By using cards like Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure, combined with disruption spells such as Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a board presence. The deck also utilizes cards like Shardless Agent and Ancestral Vision to generate card advantage and pull ahead in the mid to late game. With a mix of removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Liliana of the Veil, the deck seeks to control the board and close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand through the use of cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck focuses on setting up these combos quickly with card draw spells like Preordain and Ponder, while also having protection through Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes Cunning Wish to tutor for specific answers as needed. With a mix of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to react.

This deck aims to quickly build up infect counters on opponents' creatures, allowing for a quick win through poison damage. Cards like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf are key in this strategy, while supporting cards like Invigorate and Berserk help deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo pieces. The mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency and speed in the early game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with infect damage before they can establish their own strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies by using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Magus of the Moon, while also applying pressure through aggro creatures like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. It utilizes mana denial with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland, and has access to powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play at instant speed, and cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Stoneforge Mystic provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while attacking with efficient creatures.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly using mana acceleration like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void while attacking with efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. It also includes utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt opponents' mana bases and protect its own creatures. The key strategy is to overwhelm opponents with fast, hard-hitting creatures while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. With access to a variety of powerful lands and versatile removal spells, the deck can adapt to different situations while maintaining a proactive game plan. It aims to control the tempo of the game and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library in one turn. The deck includes various cards to support this combo, such as Goblin Welder to bring back key pieces from the graveyard, Red and Blue Elemental Blast to protect the combo, and Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base. Additional cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Phyrexian Revoker are included to control the board and prevent the opponent from interfering with the combo. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide to fuel its combo quickly.

The deck is focused on utilizing powerful disruption spells and strong creatures to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. The main strategy involves using cards like Abrupt Decay, Force of Will, and Hymn to Tourach to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent to close out the game quickly. The deck also includes efficient mana denial with Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman, along with card advantage engines like Ancestral Vision and Baleful Strix. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil provides additional value and control options.

This deck focuses on efficient and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Baleful Strix, along with disruptive spells like Abrupt Decay and Force of Will. It aims to control the game with cards like Hymn to Tourach and disruption like Wasteland, while also having card advantage with Shardless Agent and Ancestral Vision. The deck uses a combination of black, blue, and green mana sources to cast a range of spells and threats, and utilizes planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to further control the board and outvalue opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by manipulating the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan. With key cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Counterspell, the deck aims to counter and remove threats while establishing card advantage. The combination of Terminus, Entreat the Angels, Counterbalance, and Sensei's Divining Top allows for efficient board control and card selection. The deck also includes a variety of land fetch cards to ensure proper color fixing and consistency in casting spells.
